com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class SearchRequestBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.SearchRequestBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataProvider, SiperianObjectUidProvider, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SearchHmQueryRequest, SearchMatchRequest, SearchQueryRequest

    public abstract class SearchRequestBase
extends SiperianObjectRequest
implements DataProvider
    Base class for search requests (SearchQuery and SearchMatch) with parameters for paging and sorting.

    Parameters for the paging mechanism for returning large resultsets:

    • Maximum number of records returned. This parameter can be specified at the ORS level and it is stored in the CMX_SYSTEM.C_REPOS_DATABASE.GETLIST_LIMIT parameter. This limit takes precedence over the values specified using setRecordsToReturn(int). The search queries will be limited to the minimum value of the two for any search request. For SearchMatchRequest API, there are also additional parameters that can be specified on the Cleanse/Match server to control the number of matches the the Hub will attempt before returning the results.

    • Number of records: setRecordsToReturn(int). When paging is enabled this parameter specifies the size of the first page of data returned by the search API. Subsequent pages can be returned using the GetSearchResultsRequest API. Alternatively, for requests that have paging disabled this method would specify the limit of the total number of rows returned by the search API.
    • The paging mechanism is enabled by default. It can be disabled using the setDisablePaging() methods of the SearchQuery and SearchMatch APIs.

    • The search token is deleted after a period of inactivity longer than the sif.search.result.query.timeToLive.seconds setting specified in the Hub Server properties. GetSearchResults calls made after the token is expired would result in an error.

    Additionally, this class provides the setSortCriteria(String) method for setting the sorting criteria for the resultsets returned by the search APIs.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getFilterCriteria

        public String getFilterCriteria()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        See Also:
        setFilterCriteria(String)

      • setFilterCriteria

        public void setFilterCriteria(String filterCriteria)
        Specifies the filter conditions for the query. May be used to specify the literal expressions (FIRST_NAME = 'JOHN') or it may be used in combination with the setFilterParameters(ArrayList) to specify the parameterized queries (FIRST_NAME = ?) when the specific values for the parameter are provided as a list through the setFilterParameters(ArrayList) method.

        Parameters:
        filterCriteria - SQL condition clause used to select records.

      • getFilterParameters

        public ArrayList getFilterParameters()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Returns:
        ArrayList(String) of parameters; default is empty ArrayList; can be null.

        See Also:
        setFilterParameters(ArrayList)

      • setFilterParameters

        public void setFilterParameters(ArrayList filterParameters)
        Used to set parameters in the filter criteria specified in setFilterCriteria(String).

        Each element in the list is matched to the place holders specified in the filter criteria by ? symbols. The list is expected to hold Parameter objects.

        Parameters:
        filterParameters - ArrayList <Parameter> of parameters.

      • getRecordsToReturn

        public int getRecordsToReturn()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Returns:
        Maximum number of records to return.

        See Also:
        setRecordsToReturn(int)

      • setRecordsToReturn

        public void setRecordsToReturn(int recordsToReturn)
        Sets the number of records to return. The value of this parameter will be ignored if it exceeds the system settings for the maximum size of search results, which is specified in the C_REPOS_DATABASE table of the Hub system database.

        Parameters:
        recordsToReturn - Maximum number of records to return.

      • getReturnTotal

        public boolean getReturnTotal()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Returns:
        True = Return all records.

        See Also:
        setReturnTotal(boolean)

      • setReturnTotal

        public void setReturnTotal(boolean returnTotal)
        Sets whether to calculate the total number of rows satisfying the search criteria. Setting this parameter to true may have significant performance implications. Calculating the total number of records satisfying the search criteria requires execution of an extra (potentially) expensive query.

        Parameters:
        returnTotal - True - Calculate the total number of records satisfying the search criteria.

      • getSortCriteria

        public String getSortCriteria()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Returns:
        Sort string for ordering results.

        See Also:
        setSortCriteria(String)

      • setSortCriteria

        public void setSortCriteria(String sortCriteria)
        Criteria for ordering results. A comma-separated string containing names of fields in the package used to return the search data. The direction of sort may also be specified using ASC for ascending and DESC for descending. This is the same as in the ORDER BY clause of a SQL query.

        For example: "LAST_NAME ASC, FIRST_NAME ASC"

        Parameters:
        sortCriteria - Comma separated list of column names.

      • getTransactionAttributeType

        public TransactionAttributeType getTransactionAttributeType()
        Each concrete request class will have a transaction type that it uses.

        This only matters when EjbSiperianClient is used, where your application code can process multiple requests in one transaction (and use rollback, and so on) by running within an EJB context or by creating a UserTransaction.

        If the subclass does not override this method, the default here is TransactionAttributeType.SUPPORTS

        Overrides:
        getTransactionAttributeType in class SiperianRequest
        Returns:
        Never null, and constant for each request subclass.

        public List<Record> getData()
        Specified by:
